intro: Dischisma hispidum, commonly known as the hairy dischisma, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, hairy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers, which range in color from pink to purple, bloom in late summer and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Dischisma hispidum is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
